title: Nals Margreid 2014 Penon Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate but enticing scents of apple, citrus peel and Alpine herb lift out of the glass. The linear, elegant palate shows Kaiser pear, pineapple and a note of flinty mineral accompanied by lively acidity.

title: Nals Margreid 2014 Sirmian Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: An impressive effort for this cool, wet vintage, it opens with aromas of green apple, citrus and tropical fruit. The aromas follow through to the lively palate along with a mineral note while racy acidity leaves a clean, tangy finish.

title: Robert Klingenfus 2013 Bruderthal Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Rather perfumed, lifted notes of honeysuckle and the full force of lemon-drizzled honeydew melon make for a striking opening. The palate is bright and brings ample fruit: citrus-tempered apple, plums, apricots and peaches. This is joyous in its exuberance, even without much complexity. Drink soon.

title: Robert Oatley 2014 Riesling (Great Southern)
description: This is a fine, well-made example of dry Riesling. After a touch of struck flint on the nose, green apple and lime notes take firm hold and persist through the long finish, picking up attractive hints of wet stone.

title: TH 2013 The 46 Grenache-Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Pressed blueberry, black pepper and pencil lead show on this nose of this 50% Grenache and 50% Syrah blend by former football pro Terry Hoage, who recently renamed his brand. The palate on this juicy yet spicy bottling offers smoked meats and beef-jerky flavors with tar, black pepper and tangy boysenberry.

title: Quinta do Noval 2011 Cedro do Noval Red (Duriense)
description: Labeled as a regional wine rather than as a Douro wine because of the Syrah in the blend, this is still a wine from the Noval estate. Dark in color and still showing firm tannins, this second wine of Noval is made to develop relatively quickly and is ready to drink now. Ripe blackberry flavors are already evident, followed by juicy acidity and some spice tannins.

title: Franz Gojer-Glögglhof 2014 Karneid Kerner (Alto Adige)
description: This structured white opens with enticing scents of citrus and orchard fruit. The vibrant, full-bodied palate delivers lime, grapefruit and yellow peach accompanied by lively acidity. A mineral note signals the finish.

title: Franz Gojer-Glögglhof 2014 Karneid Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Classic varietal aromas of tomato leaf, hay and passion fruit lead the nose on this fragrant white. The elegantly structured palate offers grapefruit, white peach and mineral alongside crisp acidity.

title: Gill's Pier 2012 Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Nicely concentrated aromas of black currants meet tobacco, bell pepper and pencil lead on the nose. There's great verve and tenison on the medium-bodied palate, with tart blackberries against a backdrop of graphite and cocoa dust.

title: Fairview 2013 Nurok White (Paarl)
description: There's a layered complexity to this interesting blend of 47% Viognier, 32% Chenin Blanc, 18% Roussanne and 3% Grenache Blanc, with a beautiful interplay between the fruity notes of citrus peel, tart melon, green apple and plum and the earthy tones of fynbos, almond skin and sweet baking spice. The plush texture is countered by ample acidity, leading into a clean finish that's laced with toasty accents. Drink now–2018.

title: Honoratus 2008 Aurum Crianza White (Rioja)
description: This oxidized, woody white displays Sherry aromas of flor and peanut buttter, but little to no fruit. Crisp acidity corrals the palate, while barrel-driven flavors are front and center, and once again, fruit is hard to find. Overall, this is stylistically iconoclastic, but the execution is good. Drink through 2022.

title: Hunt Cellars 2010 Rhapsody in Red Destiny Vineyards Red (Paso Robles)
description: Decadent aromas of kirsch liqueur, pipe smoke and campfire waft from this wine by David Hunt, who is also a blind piano impresario. Leathery flavors of cooked cherries, smoked berries, baked cookies and a strong coffee character power the palate.

title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2013 Friulano (Collio)
description: Beeswax, acacia and aromas of pressed yellow flower are front and center on this lively wine while the vibrant palate offer yellow peach, crisp apple and toasted almond. It's lively and balanced, with a fresh finish.

title: Lammershoek 2013 LAM White (Swartland)
description: This organic bottling, made by the winery's former Winemaker Craig Hawkins (who now spearheads his own brand, Testalonga), is a blend of 54% Chenin Blanc, 31% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay. There's an immediately attractive richness to the nose, thanks to upfront notes of beeswax, honeysuckle, Asian pear, yellow apple and a touch of guava. The medium-weight mouthfeel is surprisingly direct and clean, with tart white fruit and pure citrus tones that carry through to the bright finish. Drink now–2018.

title: Las Positas 2012 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Driven by vivid blackberry and black cherry flavors, this medium-bodied wine tastes pure, concentrated, and true to the grape variety. It has mild tannins, fresh acidity and an appealing sense of balance.

title: Left Foot Charley 2014 Island View Corner Pinot Blanc (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: This single-vineyard offering from northern Michigan is citrus and pear driven on the nose, with milky white flowers offering nuance. Crunchy green pear and apple appear on the light-to-medium bodied palate and linger on the slightly waxy finish.

title: Jermann 2014 Pinot Bianco (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas and flavors of green apple and white peach come together on this lively, elegant white. Racy acidity lifts up the creamy flavors while a mineral vein ties it all together.

title: Karl Josef 2014 Piesporter Michelsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Concentrated swells of peach and honey sweeten this bright, sunny off-dry kabinett. While crisp, almost lacy, in mouthfeel, stark, lemony acidity drives a piercing finish. Drink now.

title: McManis 2014 Syrah (California)
description: With aromas like blackberry jam on toast, the flavors are ripe but dry and a firm texture with moderate tannins. This is a fresh and well-made wine at a terrific price.

title: Midnight 2011 Mare Nectaris Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Merlot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc shows cocoa dust, leather, beef jerky, dried blueberries and boysenberries on the nose. The palate is dense with tarry fruit notes, offering dark elderberries and smoked beef flavors.

title: Altos Las Hormigas 2012 Terroir Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Wiry raspberry and plum aromas put this in the red-fruit category. A loud, tannic, expansive palate blazes with acidity, while fully toasted oak gives this a burnt element to match raspberry and red-plum flavors. Hard tannins and bold acidity make for a long, rugged finish.

title: Barkan 2013 Classic Pinot Noir (Negev)
description: Dark garnet in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of black cherry, vanilla and anise. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry, chocolate and violet roll on the tongue amidst almost chewy tannins that are kept in check by bright acidity. There is a strong note of cranberry on the finish and a touch of chocolate on the post-palate.

title: Bel Lago 2012 Moreno Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: This reserve wine sees 29 months in French oak, which gives enticing sandalwood and dusty dried-herb tones to a core of ripe red cherry. These notes carry to the plush palate, where tobacco and spice progress to a lingering finish. With dusty tannins giving support to the ample weight, this wine is approachable now.

title: Bernat 2010 Estate Grown Nebbiolo (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a dusty and maduro-cigar character to the nose of this bottling, with caramel, dried herbs, tart red cherry and cranberry aromas as well. The palate shows lots of purple flowers with bouncy red-cherry fruit, nearing raspberry, proving to be a well-structured and lively wine.

title: Castello di Buttrio 2013 Mon Blanc White (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: A blend of Friulano, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this opens with scents of Spanish broom, beeswax and honey. The elegantly structured palate offers yellow apple, pear, bitter almond and mineral alongside bright acidity. It's a nice combination of flavor and finesse.

title: Castello di Spessa 2014 Pinot Bianco (Collio)
description: There's lots to like on this polished white, starting with enticing scents of apple, wildflower, beeswax and pineapple. The svelte, elegant palate offers Kaiser pear and mineral underscored by vibrant acidity.

title: Château Cos Labory 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. With the typical core of dry tannins that is Saint-Estèphe, this wine also boasts light fruit character and crisp acidity. It is on the dry side, and those tannins may be too much for the fruit.

title: Château Daugay 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is an attractive wine with pure fruit. It has vibrant acidity and spicy tannins, alongside fresh, rounded fruit tones.

title: Clos Dady 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe and generous wine. It is opulent and full-bodied, with flavors or orange jenny, ginger and other baking spice.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2012 Quailhurst Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Asian spices, plum jelly and milk chocolate flavors combine in this solid effort, which lacks only a bit more midpalate weight to really excel. As it stands, it is a tasty wine with a slight dip between start and finish.
